Identification_Area.title: ESO NTT IRSPEC IMAGE DATA FROM SL9 IMPACTS WITH JUPITER V1.0

Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Schulz, R., Th. Encrenaz, J.A. Stuewe, and G. Wiedemann. Near-IR emissions in the upper Jovian atmosphere after SL-9 impact: Indications of possible northern counterparts, Geophysical Research Letters, 22, 17, 2421-2424, 1995.

Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: ESO NTT IRSPEC IMAGE DATA FROM SL9 IMPACTS WITH JUPITER V1.0
Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Schulz, R., M. A'Hearn, Th. Encrenaz, J. Stuwe, and G. Wiedemann, ESO NTT IRSPEC IMAGE DATA FROM SL9 IMPACTS WITH JUPITER V1.0, ESO-J-IRSPEC-3-RDR-SL9-V1.0, NASA Planetary Data System, 1996.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: ESO NTT IRSPEC Images of the P/Shoemaker-Levy 9 impact into Jupiter
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: At the ESO La Silla site is a direct imaging facility (DIFA) at the A Nasmyth focus of the NTT, in front of the image derotator which feeds the IRSPEC infrared spectrograph. Two remotely-controlled 45-degree mirrors can be inserted in the light beam to deviate the telescope beam either to a CCD camera (SUSI) or to an infrared array.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= At the ESO La Silla site is a direct imaging facility (DIFA) at the A Nasmyth focus of the NTT, in front of the image derotator which feeds the IRSPEC infrared spectrograph. Two remotely-controlled 45-degree mirrors can be inserted in the light beam to deviate the telescope beam either to a CCD camera (SUSI) or to an infrared array.
The IRSPEC at the NTT was upgraded at the beginning of the 1991 season by replacing its linear detector with a 2D SBRC 58x62 pixel InSb array which exhibits good cosmetic quality and high quantum efficiency from 1 to 5 micrometers. In order to optimize the performance of this array, a multiple non-destructive sampling mode was included within the new VME-based acquisition system developed at ESO. Together with measures to reduce the instrumental background, an improvement in sensitivity of about 20 has been achieved in the 1-2.5-micrometer region. The resolving power now ranges from 1500 to 3000 for two pixel sampling with a 4-arcsec slit, and the slit length is 2 arcmin.
Processing ========== The IRSPEC data have two PIs: Rita Schulz and Therese Encrenaz with CoIs: Joachim Steuwe, and Gunther Wiedemann. The IRSPEC data were taken from July 23 through July 31. The data have been 'flux calibrated' but due to the difficult weather situation during the observations the values have to be 'taken with care.'
The individual IRSPEC files have an index table (IRSPINDX) located in the INDEX directory.
Data structure ============== SIMPLE = T / Standard FITS format BITPIX = 32 / No. of bits per pixel NAXIS = 2 / No. of axes in image NAXIS1 = 61 / No. of pixels NAXIS2 = 30 / No. of pixels EXTEND = T / FITS extension may be present BLOCKED = T / FITS file may be blocked
CRPIX1 = 1 / Reference pixel CRVAL1 = 2.10676 / Coordinate at reference pixel CDELT1 = 0.000473316 / Coordinate increment per pixel CTYPE1 = ' ' / Units of coordinate CRPIX2 = 1 / Reference pixel CRVAL2 = -11.6647 / Coordinate at reference pixel CDELT2 = 1 / Coordinate increment per pixel CTYPE2 = ' ' / Units of coordinate BUNIT = 'Flux Units ' / Units are watt-cm^-2-micron-1 BSCALE = 3.74938E-11 / Scaling factor: r = f*i + z BZERO = 0.0249304 / Zero offset: r = f*i + z DATAMAX = 0.105448 / Maximum data value DATAMIN = -0.0555869 / Minimum data value
ORIGIN = 'ESO-MIDAS' / Written by MIDAS DATE = '14/06/95' / Date of writting: DD/MM/YY FILENAME= 'flx0002.bdf' / Original file name MIDASFTP= 'IMAGE ' / MIDAS File Type
OBJECT = 'sky H2 &01O' / MIDAS desc.: IDENT(1) RA = 213.185 / MIDAS desc.: O_POS(1) DEC = -12.1648 / MIDAS desc.: O_POS(2) DATE-OBS= '16/07/94' / MIDAS desc.: O_TIME(1) MJD-OBS = 49550 / MIDAS desc.: O_TIME(4) TM-START= 84078 / MIDAS desc.: O_TIME(5) EXPTIME = 59.995 / MIDAS desc.: O_TIME(7) AIRMASS = 1.04622 / MIDAS desc.: O_AIRM(1) INSTRUME= 'IRSPEC ' / MIDAS desc.: INSTRUME(1) COMMENT IP_JIDNT 10 / IHAP: identifier system COMMENT IP_ASCX 8. / IHAP: scaling in x COMMENT IP_ASCY 8. / IHAP: scaling in y COMMENT $EXPTIME 59.995 COMMENT $OBSERVER 'jupitertea' COMMENT IP_FILE 'IHAP/FITS/IR940716232118.FITS::USER ' / IHAP: Begin of COMMENT keyword COMMENT IP_FEND / IHAP: End of keyword file COMMENT IP_CBEND / IHAP: comment block end
HISTORY BADPIX/IRSPEC imp0002.bdf bpx0002.bdf HISTORY COMPUTE/I HISTORY AG middummbpx.bdf = (bpx0001.bdf-drk0000.bdf)/ffa_h2_1.bdf HISTORY XTRACT/IMAG ysh0002.bdf = rec0001.bdf[<,@0029:>,>] HISTORY COMPUTE/IMAG ysh0002.bdf = -1.0*ysh0002.bdf HISTORY COMPUTE/IMAG wav0002.bdf = 1.0*ysh0002.bdf HISTORY EXTRACT/IMAG middumb.bdf = wav0002.bdf[@1,<: HISTORY 0061,>] COMPUTE/IMAG middummfo.bdf = middum HISTORY .bdf COMPUTE/IMAG middummfo.bdf HISTORY = middummfo.bdf/5.99950E+01 COMPUTE/IMAG flx0 HISTORY 02.bdf = &fo/&fs
HIERARCH ESO GEN ID = 'ARCH-1.0' / Version of related document HIERARCH ESO GEN EXPO NO = -17214 / Image Sequence Number HIERARCH ESO GEN EXPO TYPE = 'SCI ' / Type of exposure HIERARCH ESO GEN EXPO LST = 51357 / Loc. Sid. time at start of e HIERARCH ESO TEL ID = 'ESONTTA ' / Telescope Identification HIERARCH ESO TEL LON = 70.7345 / Telescope Longitude (+=West) HIERARCH ESO TEL LAT = -29.2584 / Telescope Latitude (+=North) HIERARCH ESO TEL ALTITUDE = 2440 / Telescope Altitude HIERARCH ESO TEL FOCU LEN = 38.5 / Focus lenght HIERARCH ESO TEL RASC = -29.5 / Telescope R.Ascention Offset HIERARCH ESO TEL DECL = -2 / Telescope Delta Offset HIERARCH ESO INS SLIT = 560 / Size in microns HIERARCH ESO INS DECKER = 21 / Decker number 21=OP 22=CL HIERARCH ESO INS FILNUM = 4 / Filter number HIERARCH ESO INS GRATING = 2 / Grating number HIERARCH ESO INS ORDER = 1 / Grating order HIERARCH ESO INS CENWAVL = 2.1212 / Center wave length HIERARCH ESO INS BEGWAVL = 2.1068 / From wave length HIERARCH ESO INS ENDWAVL = 2.13546 / To wave length HIERARCH ESO INS RANGE = 0.02865 / Wave Length range HIERARCH ESO INS GRATEMP = 78.2 / Grating tempearature in [K] HIERARCH ESO ADA ID = 'ADAPTA ' / Adapter Identification HIERARCH ESO ADA MODE = 'STD ' / Mode (standard) HIERARCH ESO ADA ROT = -250 / Rotation at start of exposure HIERARCH ESO ADA GUID-1 X = 22 / Guide probe x position (m) HIERARCH ESO ADA GUID-1 Y = 22 / Guide probe y position (m) HIERARCH ESO ADA GUID-2 X = 0.436 / Guide probe x position (m) HIERARCH ESO ADA GUID-2 Y = 0.57 / Guide probe y position (m) HIERARCH ESO DET NAME = 'SBRC 62 X 58' / Detector name HIERARCH ESO DET PIXSIZE = 7.5E-05 / Size of pixel (m) HIERARCH ESO DET BITS = 16 / ADU bits per pixel HIERARCH ESO DET STORAG = 0 / Images are stored as scan-lines HIERARCH ESO DET DIT = 59.995 / Detector Integration Time(sec) HIERARCH ESO DET NDIT = 5 / # of integrations/measurement HIERARCH ESO DET NINT = 1 / # of measurements HIERARCH ESO DET DUMDIT = 0 / # of dummy readouts HIERARCH ESO DET TEMPMIN = 29.98 / Detector temp. min. HIERARCH ESO DET TEMPMAX = 30.07 / Detector temp. max. HIERARCH ESO DET VBIAS = -3.5 / Bias (reset) voltage HIERARCH ESO DET VGATE = -2.8 / Gate voltage HIERARCH ESO DET NCORRS = 4 / Sampling method: NONDEST HIERARCH ESO DET RSPD = 8 / Microprogram: read speed HIERARCH ESO DET NSAMPLES = 1115 / #of samples/DIT

Software ======== Standard IRAF reduction routines were used.
Media/Format ============ This dataset is 8 MM tape submission to PDS which was referenced in the Schulz et al. (1995) [SCHULZETAL1995] article.
